com.tinmegali.security.mcipher

Class MDecryptorDefault

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.tinmegali.security.mcipher.MDecryptorDefault
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MDecryptor

    public class MDecryptorDefault
extends java.lang.Object
implements MDecryptor
    Decrypts data using Android's native libraries. Compatible with SDK 19+. The decryption process will adapt itself to the current SDK, using the same logic adopted in the MEncryptorDefault. For any decryption process to work correctly, the MDecryptor configuration must be compatible with the MEncryptor configuration used during the encryption process. Use the class builder MDecryptorBuilder to instantiate and configure a MDecryptor object.

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(byte[] encryptedData,
                      android.content.Context context)
               throws MDecryptorException
        Decrypt a given byte array, returning a byte array. Checks if the encrypted data is considered 'large', and calls decryptLargeData(byte[], Context) if necessary. Notice that for the method to work, the MDecryptor configuration must be compatible with the configuration used on the MEncryptor during the encryption process.
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface MDecryptor
        Parameters:
        encryptedData - a byte array with the encrypted data.
        context - the context must only be passed when the method is called from SDK previous to 23.
        Returns:
        a decrypted byte array.
        Throws:
        MDecryptorException - wraps all possible exception for the decryption process. To access the original exception call Throwable.getCause().
        See Also:
        getCipher(String, byte[]), decryptData(byte[], Cipher), decryptLargeData(byte[], Context)

      • decrypt

        public byte[] decrypt(java.lang.String encryptedString,
                      android.content.Context context)
               throws MDecryptorException
        Decrypts a given String, returning a decrypted byte array. The encrypted String must have been encoded with MCipherUtils.encodeEncrypted(byte[]) or be obtained by MEncryptor.encryptString(String, Context) method. The decryption process is done by decrypt(byte[], Context). Notice that for the method to work, the MDecryptor configuration must be compatible with the configuration used on the MEncryptor during the encryption process.
        Specified by:
        decrypt in interface MDecryptor
        Parameters:
        encryptedString - a String to be decrypted. It must have been encoded using MCipherUtils.encodeEncrypted(byte[]) method.
        context - the context must only be passed when the method is called from SDK previous to 23.
        Returns:
        a decrypted byte array.
        Throws:
        MDecryptorException - wraps all possible exception for the decryption process. To access the original exception call Throwable.getCause().
        See Also:
        MCipherUtils.decodeEncrypted(String), decrypt(byte[], Context)

        Decrypts a given String, returning a decrypted String. The encrypted String must have been encoded with MCipherUtils.encodeEncrypted(byte[]) or be obtained by MEncryptor.encryptString(String, Context) method. The decryption process is done by decrypt(byte[], Context). Notice that for the method to work, the MDecryptor configuration must be compatible with the configuration used on the MEncryptor during the encryption process.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        encryptedString - a String to be decrypted. It must have been encoded using MCipherUtils.encodeEncrypted(byte[]) method.
        context - the context must only be passed when the method is called from SDK previous to 23.
        Returns:
        a decrypted String
        Throws:
        MDecryptorException - wraps all possible exception for the decryption process. To access the original exception call Throwable.getCause().@throws MDecryptorException

      • decryptLargeData

        protected byte[] decryptLargeData(byte[] encryptedData,
                                  android.content.Context context)
                           throws MDecryptorException
        Decrypts large chunks of data. For SDK previous to 23, it loads a Cipher used to wrap a SecretKey used during the encryption process and then uses this Cipher to decrypt with decryptWithStream(byte[], Cipher). For SDK 23+, call decryptWithStream(byte[], Cipher). The encrypted data must contain the vector IV used during encryption, that is obtained by a deserialization of a MEncryptedObject.
        Parameters:
        encryptedData - encrypted data
        context - current Context.
        Returns:
        a byte array with the decrypted data.
        Throws:
        MDecryptorException - for any errors.
        See Also:
        MEncryptedObject.getEncryptedObject(byte[]), MEncryptedObject.getCypherIV(), wrapperCipher(String, Context, byte[]), decryptWithStream(byte[], Cipher)

      • decryptWithStream

        protected byte[] decryptWithStream(byte[] toDecrypt,
                                   javax.crypto.Cipher cipher)
                            throws java.io.IOException
        Decrypt large chunks of data using CipherInputStream.
        Parameters:
        toDecrypt - data to decrypt
        cipher - cipher used in the decryption
        Returns:
        a decrypted byte array
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

                             java.security.InvalidKeyException,

                             java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        Decrypt a given byte array using the provided Cipher
        Parameters:

        cipher - Cipher to be used in the decryption operation.
        Returns:
        A byte array with the decrypted data.
        Throws:

      • getCipher

        protected javax.crypto.Cipher getCipher(java.lang.String alias,
                                        byte[] encryptionIV)
                                 throws java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                        java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException,
                                        java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                        MDecryptorException,
                                        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        Load a Cipher according to Android's SDK in use. By default, in API 23+, the Cipher uses the transformation 'AES/GCM/NoPadding' and for API < 23 it uses 'RSA/ECB/PKCS1Padding'. The Cipher also takes into consideration the current SDK to define if it will need a SecretKey for SDK 23+ or a KeyPair's PrivateKey on older systems.
        Parameters:
        alias - an unique identifier used to load a SecretKey ot a KeyPair previously stored in the KeyStore.
        encryptionIV - the vector IV used during at the encryption process. Only used for encryption made with algorithm 'AES' (SDK 23+).
        Returns:
        a Cipher loaded with Cipher.DECRYPT_MODE
        Throws:
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        MDecryptorException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        See Also:
        getSecretKey(String), getKeyPair(String)

      • getSecretKey

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey getSecretKey(java.lang.String alias)
                                       throws java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException,
                                              java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                              java.security.KeyStoreException
        Recovers a SecretKey that was used during the encryption process. This method is the aimed for Android SDK 23+. For SDK < 23, use getKeyPair(String).
        Parameters:
        alias - a unique id that was used to save the SecretKey in the KeyStore.
        Returns:
        s SecretKey to be used in the decryption process.
        Throws:
        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException

      • getKeyPair

        protected java.security.KeyPair getKeyPair(java.lang.String alias)
                                    throws java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException,
                                           java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                           java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                           MDecryptorException
        Recovers a KeyPair composed of a PublicKey and a SecretKey. The KeyPair was used during the encryption process. Keep in mind that KeyPair.getPublic() should be use for encryption and KeyPair.getPrivate() for decryption. This method is aimed for Android SDK < 23. For SDK 23+, use getSecretKey(String).
        Parameters:
        alias - a unique id that was used to save the SecretKey in the KeyStore.
        Returns:
        a KeyPair containing a public and a secret key.
        Throws:
        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        MDecryptorException

      • wrapperCipher

        protected javax.crypto.Cipher wrapperCipher(java.lang.String alias,
                                            android.content.Context context,
                                            byte[] cipherIV)
                                     throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                            java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                            java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                            java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException,
                                            java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                            java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                            java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                            javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                            MDecryptorException,
                                            MKeyWrapperException,
                                            java.io.IOException,
                                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Generate a Cipher to be used with the decryptLargeData(byte[], Context). It 'unWraps' a SecretKey used to encrypt large chunks of data in SDKs previous to 23, and uses this key to generate the Cipher.
        Parameters:
        alias - unique identifier tight to secret key.
        context - current Context.
        cipherIV - the vector IV used during encryption.
        Returns:
        a Cipher to be used in the decryption process of large chunks of data in older SDKs.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        MDecryptorException
        MKeyWrapperException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        See Also:
        getUnwrappedLargeKey(String, Context)

      • getUnwrappedLargeKey

        protected javax.crypto.SecretKey getUnwrappedLargeKey(java.lang.String alias,
                                                      android.content.Context context)
                                               throws javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException,
                                                      java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException,
                                                      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                                      java.security.KeyStoreException,
                                                      java.security.InvalidKeyException,
                                                      java.security.NoSuchProviderException,
                                                      java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException,
                                                      javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException,
                                                      MDecryptorException,
                                                      MKeyWrapperException,
                                                      java.io.IOException,
                                                      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Loads a SecretKey used in the encryption process of large chunks of data in SDKs previous to 23. It relies on the utility method MKeyWrapper.loadWrappedLargeKey(Context, Key, String) to load the key. This method is to be called only by SDKs previous to 23, otherwise it will throw an MDecryptorException.
        Parameters:
        alias - unique identifier tight to standard secret key.
        context - current Context.
        Returns:
        a SecretKey to be used in the decryption of large chunks of data.
        Throws:
        javax.crypto.NoSuchPaddingException
        java.security.UnrecoverableEntryException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.KeyStoreException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException
        java.security.NoSuchProviderException
        java.security.InvalidAlgorithmParameterException
        javax.crypto.IllegalBlockSizeException
        MDecryptorException
        MKeyWrapperException
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        See Also:
        MKeyWrapper.loadWrappedLargeKey(Context, Key, String)
